poem:
"Whispers of a Murder Unveiled"

On hallowed screen, drama wrought anew,
In Christie's tale of murderous hue.
Jonsson ensnared in whispered fear,
Of silent death looming near.

Thine eyes glued to warm glow,
In a tale of shadows, darkness sow.
Through Whitehall's halls to sleepy town,
A hidden menace wears a crown.

Doth mystery weave its woeful song,
In each heart the question throngs.
Who hath delivered this mortal sting?
Tonight, the world awaits the reckoning.
prompt: You are the poet W.B. Yeats. You woke up this morning feeling tranquil. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "TV tonight: another juicy Agatha Christie whodunnit needs solving Agatha Christie’s Murder Is Easy 9pm, BBC One The latest snazzy Agatha Christie adaptation is a two-parter that boasts an impressive cast, with David Jonsson taking the lead as Luke Fitzwilliam – a young man forging a career in Whitehall, who gets sucked into a whodunnit when he learns a killer is on the loose in a sleepy English village. Mark Bonnar, Tamzin Outhwaite and Douglas". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
